alert.note: Alert for Clark; Floyd (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 5:42PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Clark, east central Floyd, Oldham and Jefferson Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 540 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kingsley, moving north at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Torrential rainfall could cause localized ponding and low visibility. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Graymoor-Devondale, Anchorage, Barbourmeade, Northfield, Rolling Hills, Langdon Place, Plantation, Meadow Vale, Spring Valley and Brownsboro Farm around 545 PM EDT. Prospect, Worthington Hills, Coldstream, Green Spring and Glenview around 550 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
